aux.sampleValue: cvd
Abbeyfield Scotland Ltd

fields.name: cvdf005
fields.label: F1.5 Welcome

aux.sampleValue:
Welcome to the Covid-19 quarterly return. 

The information provided in this return will help the Social Housing Resilience Group (SHRG) and interested stakeholders monitor the potential impact, including financial impact, on landlords and to consider support that landlords may need in the longer term.

The SHRG will keep under review the ongoing need for this information, and we will continue to collect the information until the SHRG confirms it no longer requires it.

The quarterly return is made available at the end of each quarter and a submission date 14 working days after the quarter end. 

Thank you once again for your assistance. If you have any questions on this please contact your lead regulator in the first instance.

fields.title: Welcome
fields.text:
Welcome to the Covid-19 quarterly return.

The information provided in this return will help the Social Housing Resilience Group (SHRG) and interested stakeholders monitor the potential impact, including financial impact, on landlords and to consider support that landlords may need in the longer term.

The SHRG will keep under review the ongoing need for this information, and we will continue to collect the information until the SHRG confirms it no longer requires it.

The quarterly return is made available at the end of each quarter and a submission date 14 working days after the quarter end.

Thank you once again for your assistance. If you have any questions on this please contact your lead regulator in the first instance.

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_3
children.header: Please tell us your staff absence level on the last day of the quarter:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_5
children.header: Total number of staff (FTE)

children.name: cvd001
children.label: Total number of staff (FTE)
children.help: Permanent or temporary staff employed by the RSL or by any of its subsidiaries on the last day of the reporting quarter which carry out duties for the RSL. The number of staff should be reported in terms of full-time equivalents (FTE). For example, if the hours of two people working part-time are added together that might be the same as one full-time job.

aux.sampleValue: Total number of staff (FTE) Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_6
children.header: Total number absent (FTE)

children.name: cvd002
children.label: Total number absent (FTE)
children.help: Number of staff (FTE) not available to work, because of ill-health, care responsibilities, compassionate leave, other reasons (excluding those placed on furlough) on the last day of the reporting quarter.

aux.sampleValue: Total number absent (FTE) Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_7
children.header: Percentage of staff absent

children.name: cvd003
children.label: Percentage of staff absent
children.help: To calculate the percentage we will divide the total number absent (FTE) by the total number of staff (FTE) and multiply by 100.

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_9
children.header: Number of staff placed on furlough (FTE)

children.name: cvd004
children.label: Number of staff placed on furlough (FTE)
children.help:
Number of staff placed on furlough in accordance with the UK Government's furlough scheme. From 1 July 2020 employers can bring furloughed employees back to work for any amount of time and any shift pattern. Where employees are brought back to work for any amount of time, provide the FTE of furloughed staff time
Furloughed Staff Calculation Example
Staff members's total working hours = 40
Actual hours worked = 10
Hours on furlough = 30
FTE for staff placed on furlough = (30 / 40) = 0.75

children.name: cvd008
children.label: Number of staff placed on furlough (FTE)

aux.sampleValue: Number of staff placed on furlough (FTE) Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_10
children.header: Percentage of staff placed on furlough

children.name: cvd005
children.label: Percentage of staff placed on furlough

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_12
children.header: Please tell us your rent and arrears on the last day of the quarter:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_14
children.header: Gross rent arrears

children.name: cvd009
children.label: Gross rent arrears
children.help:
Gross rent arrears for the reporting quarter. Gross rent arrears consists of the value (to the nearest £) of current and former tenant rent arrears as at the end of each quarter or the closest end of debit period prior to any arrears write-off. Rent paid in advance should not be used to offset the overall value.
Do not include as arrears:
• The value of any outstanding payments from people who have an agreement to pay their rent slightly later than the landlord’s normal monthly rent cycle i.e. agreements to make payments in the next rental cycle; and
• The value of any outstanding Housing Benefit/Universal Credit payments due for that quarter but not received until after the start of the next quarter.

aux.sampleValue: Gross rent arrears Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_15
children.header: Total annual rent due

children.name: cvd010
children.label: Total annual rent due
children.help: Total rent due is the value (to the nearest £) of the total annual charges levied by the landlord in respect of rent and service charges for dwellings.

aux.sampleValue: Total annual rent due Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_16
children.header: Gross rent arrears (%)

children.name: cvd011
children.label: Gross rent arrears (%)
children.help: To calculate the percentage we will divide the total value of gross rent arrears by the total rent due for the year and multiply by 100.

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_18
children.header: Please tell us your direct housing payments during the quarter:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_20
children.header: Total amount of rent due for the reporting quarter

children.name: cvd022
children.label: Total amount of rent due for the reporting quarter
children.help:
The total charges levied by the landlord in respect of rent and service charges for the reporting quarter. Subject to the exclusions listed below.
When calculating the total rent due and the rent loss do not include:
• lock-ups and garages
• sharing owners
• Properties used for temporary homeless lets
• Leased properties
• Rent (including service charges) for periods when properties are empty subject to an insurance claim being raised because of fire of flood damage
• Empty properties awaiting or undergoing major repairs/restructural work during which the period it would be unsafe for them to be occupied (N.B. Following completion of major repair work any subsequent void period occurring until the date of re-let should be counted as a void (i.e. any void period from the start date of a new tenancy is to be included in the reported rent lost through properties being empty and rental income lost)).
• Rent lost due to periods of time when major improvement/modernisation works are being undertaken. So major that it cannot reasonably be occupied
• Rent lost due to reasonable time taken to clear the house following a tenant’s death
• Rent for properties where the keys are held by the Police to assist with their investigation
• Properties held for decanting tenants
• Properties which are empty and subject of a Governing Body/Sub-Committee/Council decision that they are not to be let because they are surplus to long-term requirements, or to be transferred, disposed of or demolished; or reconfigured.
Ensure to include:
• only the amount (£’s) of rent lost for the current rent accounting quarter when reporting loss for a property that spans across two rent accounting quarters, and
• service charges, in the calculations

children.name: cvd025
children.label: Total amount of rent due for the reporting quarter

aux.sampleValue: Total amount of rent due for the reporting quarter Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_21
children.header: Direct housing cost payments received

children.name: cvd014
children.label: Direct housing cost payments received
children.help:
Value of payments received: The total amount (£s) of housing costs (Housing Benefit/Universal Credit/Discretionary Housing Payments) paid directly to the landlord during the reporting quarter, irrespective of what period the payments relate to.
Ensure to deduct any overpayments of housing costs recovered from direct payments received (regardless to which quarter the recovery is in respect of) when calculating the value of payments received.
We recognise that this figure may change after the reporting quarter due to the timing of payments. As a result we are not asking landlords to submit updates or corrections to the reported figures for this indicator.

aux.sampleValue: Direct housing cost payments received Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_22
children.header: Percentage of Total amount of rent due for the reporting quarter from direct housing cost payments (%)

children.name: cvd015
children.label: Percentage of rental income from direct housing cost payments (%)

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_24
children.header: Please tell us about your empty homes:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_26
children.header: Empty homes (last day of previous quarter)

children.name: cvd017
children.label: Empty homes (last day of previous quarter)
children.help: The total number of empty dwellings on the last day of the previous reporting quarter. An empty home is a property owned by a landlord which has no tenant. We will pre populate this field using the figure submitted in the previous quarter’s return.

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_27
children.header: Empty homes (arose during the quarter)

children.name: cvd018
children.label: Empty homes (arose during the quarter)
children.help: The number of empty dwellings that arose during the reporting quarter in self-contained lettable stock.

aux.sampleValue: Empty homes (arose during the quarter) Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_28
children.header: Empty homes (last day of the quarter)

children.name: cvd019
children.label: Empty homes (last day of the quarter)
children.help: The total number of dwellings in self-contained lettable stock that were empty on the last day of the reporting quarter.

children.name: cvd021
children.label: Empty homes (last day of the quarter)

aux.sampleValue: Empty homes (last day of the quarter) Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_30
children.header: Please tell us your rent lost through properties being empty during the quarter:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_32
children.header: Rent due lost through properties being empty during the quarter

children.name: cvd023
children.label: Rent due lost through properties being empty during the quarter
children.help:
To calculate the percentage of rent lost through properties being empty during the last quarter we will divide total amount of rent due for the reporting quarter, by total amount of rent lost through properties being empty during the reporting quarter. Multiply by 100.
The rent loss for an empty property in relation to a new let is the amount of lost rental income (including services charges) for the time – measured in calendar days – from the date of handover to the landlord following the issue of the certificate of practical completion and the start date of the first tenancy. Subject to the exclusions listed below.
The rent loss for an empty property for a re-let is the amount of lost rental income (including services charges) for the time – measured in calendar days – between the date of termination of a previous tenancy or repossession and the start date of a new tenancy. Subject to the exclusions listed below

children.name: cvd026
children.label: Rent due lost through properties being empty during the quarter

aux.sampleValue: Rent due lost through properties being empty during the quarter Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_33
children.header: Percentage of rent due lost through properties being empty (%)

children.name: cvd024
children.label: Percentage of rent due lost through properties being empty (%)

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_35
children.header: Please tell us the average length of time to re-let properties in the last quarter:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_37
children.header: Properties re-let

children.name: cvd027
children.label: Properties re-let
children.help:
Lets: Lettings in this context are lets to individual tenants. Properties leased during the year to other organisations (i.e. to Social Work Department) should not be recorded as a let in this return. The houses may be managed by the landlord itself or by an agent on its behalf.
A re-let: A property where the previous tenancy has ended or the property has been repossessed and a new tenancy has commenced. Houses remaining empty at the end of the quarter are to be included in the following quarter’s return when they are let.

aux.sampleValue: Properties re-let Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_38
children.header: Calendar days properties were empty

children.name: cvd028
children.label: Calendar days properties were empty
children.help:
Time taken to re-let: This is measured in calendar days, between the date of termination of a previous tenancy or repossession (i.e. the first date from which the rent loss is charged to voids) and the start date of a new tenancy (i.e. the last date from which the rent loss is charged to voids) subject to the exclusions listed below.
When calculating the total number of properties that are re-let do not include:
• Mutual exchanges, successions and assignations
• New lets
• Tenancies on properties acquired through the mortgage to rent scheme or a stock transfer as re-lets at the point of acquisition. Any subsequent changes in these tenancies would be recorded in the normal manner
• Lets for lock-ups and garages
• Houses held for decanting tenants.
When calculating the time taken to re-let, do not include periods where the property is empty due to:
• An insurance claim because of fire or flood damage
• Awaiting or undergoing major repairs/ structural work during which period it would be unsafe for it to be occupied
• A Governing Body/Sub-Committee/Council decision that they are not to be let because they are to be transferred; reconfigured or disposed of/demolished or are surplus to long term requirements
• The periods of time when major improvements/modernisation works are being undertaken. So major that it cannot reasonably be occupied
• A reasonable time taken to clear the house following a tenant’s death
• Keys being held by the Police to assist with their investigation.

Ensure to include:
• following completion of major repair work any subsequent period when the property is empty until the date it is re-let
only properties that were re-let during the reporting quarter
• in the re-let calculation the total number of days where a re-let spans two reporting quarters.

aux.sampleValue: Calendar days properites were empty Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_39
children.header: Average length of time to re-let properties

children.name: cvd029
children.label: Average length of time to re-let properties

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_41
children.header: Please tell us your lets during the quarter:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_43
children.header: Number of lets to existing tenants

children.name: cvd032
children.label: Number of lets to existing tenants
children.help: Number of lets commenced during the reporting quarter to those who were already tenants in one of the landlord’s properties, who applied through the landlord’s housing list/s. (This covers all lists. For example, waiting or transfer lists or common housing registers).

children.name: cvd040
children.label: Number of lets to existing tenants

aux.sampleValue: Number of lets to existing tenants RSL Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_44
children.header: Number of lets to housing list applicants

children.name: cvd033
children.label: Number of lets to housing list applicants
children.help: Number of lets commenced during the reporting quarter to people who were not existing tenants and who were on the landlord’s housing list or the common housing register in which the landlord participates. Do not include section 5 referrals or LA nominations.

children.name: cvd041
children.label: Number of lets to housing list applicants

aux.sampleValue: Number of lets to housing list applicants RSL Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_45
children.header: Number of lets to homeless (SST)

children.name: cvd034
children.label: Number of lets to homeless (SST)
children.help: Number of lets commenced during the reporting quarter to households assessed as statutory homeless by the local authority and to whom the local authority has a duty to provide permanent housing.

aux.sampleValue: Number of lets to homeless (SST) RSL Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_46
children.header: Number of lets to homeless (short SST)

children.name: cvd035
children.label: Number of lets to homeless (short SST)
children.help: Number of lets commenced during the reporting quarter to households assessed as statutory homeless by the local authority and to whom the local authority has a duty to provide permanent housing.

children.name: cvd043
children.label: Number of lets to homeless (short SST)

aux.sampleValue: Number of lets to homeless (short SST) RSL Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_47
children.header: Number leased to relevant local authority

children.name: cvd036
children.label: Number leased to relevant local authority
children.help: Number of properties leased during the reporting quarter to the local authority, including those for use as temporary accommodation for people who are homeless. Include only those properties that were first leased to the local authority during the reporting quarter.

children.name: cvd044
children.label: Number leased to relevant local authority

aux.sampleValue: Number leased to relevant local authority RSL Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_48
children.header: Number of lets to others

children.name: cvd037
children.label: Number of lets to others
children.help: Number of new tenancies commenced during the reporting quarter from any other source not covered by the other categories.

aux.sampleValue: Number of lets to others RSL Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_49
children.header: Total lets and leased (during quarter)

children.name: cvd038
children.label: Total lets and leased (during quarter)
children.calculation: (( cvd032 + cvd033 + cvd034 + cvd035 + cvd036 + cvd037 ))
children.help: Total number of new tenancies commenced and properties first leased to the local authority for use as temporary accommodation during the reporting quarter.

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_51
children.header: Balance

children.name: cvd039
children.label: Balance
children.validationMessage: Difference between Voids and Lets is not 0. Please add a comment to explain the difference.
children.help:
Balance Calculation Example
a. Empty Homes (last day of previous quarter) = 17
b. Empty homes (arose during the quarter) = 14
c. Empty homes a the end of the quarter = 17
d. Number of lets to homeless (SST) = 6
e. Number of lets to homeles (short SST) = 6
f. Number leased to relevant local authority = 1
g. Number of lets to others (e.g. waiting list applicants) = 1
h. Total lets and leased (during quarter) = 14
Balance (this figure should be 0 to reconcile the voids and lets)
= (a + b - c) - h = 14 - 14 = 0

aux.sampleValue: Balance RSL Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_53
children.header: Please tell us your cash balance on the last day of the quarter:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_55
children.header: Cash balance

children.name: cvd047
children.label: Cash balance
children.help: Cash balances as per general ledger, including cash investments, on the last day of the reporting quarter.

aux.sampleValue: Cash balance Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_57
children.header: Number of court actions initiated and properties recovered during the quarter:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_59
children.header: Total number of court actions initiated

children.name: cvd049
children.label: Total number of court actions initiated
children.help:
Recovery of Possession (Eviction)
Section 16 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2001 as amended by Section 153 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2010, sets out the grounds on which a court can issue an order to terminate a SST and gives the landlord the right to recover possession of the property. Where landlords seek possession on the grounds of non-payment of rent, they must confirm to the court that they have met the pre-action requirements, as set out in the Housing (Scotland) Act 2010.

Court actions initiated
Following the issue of a notice of proceedings and raising a court order a landlord may initiate court action.

Reasons for eviction
When an action has been taken based on both rent arrears and anti-social behaviour, record the main reason.

Include:
∙ tenants that you have actively evicted; and
∙ tenants that abandoned their home after you had obtained decree.

children.name: cvd053
children.label: Total number of court actions initiated

aux.sampleValue: Total number of court actions initiated Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_60
children.header: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for non-payment of rent

children.name: cvd050
children.label: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for non-payment of rent

children.name: cvd054
children.label: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for non-payment of rent

aux.sampleValue: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for non-payment of rent Comment

children.header: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for anti-social behaviour

children.label: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for anti-social behaviour

children.name: cvd055
children.label: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for anti-social behaviour

aux.sampleValue: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for anti-social behaviour Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_62
children.header: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for other reasons

children.name: cvd052

children.label: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for other reasons

aux.sampleValue: The number of properties recovered having obtained decree for other reasons Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_64
children.header: Number of Notice of Proceedings issued during the quarter for:

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_66
children.header: Rent arrears

children.name: cvd057
children.label: Rent arrears
children.help:
Notice of proceedings (NOP)
As defined by Section 14 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2001 as amended by Section 155 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 2010, a NOP is a legal document issued at the first stage in the legal process for a landlord to evict a tenant. For Notice of proceedings issued, include the total number for the reporting period (not the cumulative total across quarters).

aux.sampleValue: Rent arrears Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_67
children.header: Antisocial behaviour / criminal activity

aux.sampleValue: Antisocial behaviour / criminal activity Comment

children.name: table_indicators_rsl_row_68
children.header: Other reasons

aux.sampleValue: Other reasons Comment
